results.title: In Between. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Mandy Smith and Kim Dalton
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “In Between” a series of dramas set in Melbourne that looks at the pressures of growing up. Episode Three looks at Angie who is bright, tough and enjoys life. However, life is suddenly more complicated when she discovers that she is pregnant. Episode Four is about Alex who is confused by the different pressures that his father and friends place upon him to grow up.

results.title: All that glitters
results.brief_description: In September 1982, forty-five nations of the Commonwealth sent 1,500 athletes to Brisbane for the Twelfth Commonwealth Games. This program focuses on athletes and coaches, highlighting their relationships, lifestyles and training and their individual struggles. This film is the official film of the 12th Commonwealth Games, held in Brisbane, and is a combination of the films featured in the “Striving ” series.

results.title: The Steam-driven adventures of Riverboat Bill
results.brief_description: Based on the Riverboat Bill books by Cliff Green. Riverboat Bill and young Dave Freshwater restore an old paddle steamer, and, along with a fire-breathing Bunyip and Black Ben the Pirate, have many adventures sailing the Murray River.

results.title: Nimrod
results.brief_description: This is a documentary detailing the evolution of the jet engine. With the use of rare archival footage, we are shown the rapid development of aircraft design, in particular, leading up to and during W.W.II when Germany under Hitler was making dramatic advances with the jet engine. Rated: G

results.title: Close encounters of the sexual kind
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. Designed to encourage a responsible attitude towards sex, contraception and the prevention of STD’s. The issues raised include AIDS, the need for medical check-ups, communication and condoms.

results.title: Royal Australian Navy 75 Years
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Stafford Garner and Associates
results.brief_description: Since the days of the First Fleet, Australia has been inevitably dependent on the sea - first for much needed supplies, later for trade. As Australia’s wealth was recognised and trade increased, the question of the country’s defence became more important, making the establishment of a Navy vital, and in 1911, the RAN came into being. An archival compilation narrated by Ronald Coleby.

results.title: Remembering Life
results.brief_description: A history of Life magazine which first appeared in America in November 1936. Life pioneered pictorial journalism and in the process radically altered the course of the print media. Editors, journalists and photographers involved with its production, discuss the incredible power and influence had by this pictorial.

results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: Sally Pryor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A dream in which the dreamer imagines she can travel into her own brain using computer animation. This brain has a structure like a house, with each room containing images of personality and personal experience.

results.title: Introduction to Microwave Cookery
results.brief_description: Virginia Hill presents a videotape that will take the mystery out of microwave cooking. Microwave cooking is easy, nutritious and fun when you know how. This tape takes the viewer through a step-by-step guide to the microwave oven and its effective use.

results.title: Rocking the foundations
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
results.brief_description: A film that goes behind the headlines to look at the extraordinary chain of events that has made the New South Wales Builders’ Labourers’ Federation the controversial part of Australian history that it is today. It is a story about workers who began to act for themselves and make decisions about issues that affected ordinary people. Also looks at the new policies that saw women introduced into the building industry, limited tenure of office and the use of union power to assist resident action and environmental groups. Narrated by Pat Fiske. (NOTE: 16mm print is black and white.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
